content.body:
> <@annevk:mozilla.org> tusf: it's a tree. Not aware of articles, but in the early days linked list vs array for representing children was a topic.

Gotcha. Thought I'd try experimenting with a document representation that was non-hierarchical, but I suppose that would need something outside the DOM (or a specialized extension of it; based on Ranges, perhaps?)
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:mozilla.org
tusf: it's a tree. Not aware of articles, but in the early days linked list vs array for representing children was a topic.
Gotcha. Thought I'd try experimenting with a document representation that was non-hierarchical, but I suppose that would need something outside the DOM (or a specialized extension of it; based on Ranges, perhaps?)

content.body: Benjamin Gruenbaum: FWIW, composing AbortSignal objects is still something we should do, but we need someone to do the work essentially :-)
content.formatted_body: Benjamin Gruenbaum: FWIW, composing AbortSignal objects is still something we should do, but we need someone to do the work essentially :-)

content.body: Benjamin Gruenbaum: there's also another tricky issue about making AbortSignal work well with timeouts, for which you really want to expose a cancel reason (or use a different exception, as XHR does)
content.formatted_body: Benjamin Gruenbaum: there's also another tricky issue about making AbortSignal work well with timeouts, for which you really want to expose a cancel reason (or use a different exception, as XHR does)
